titleStmt.title: The displaying of the Life-Guards colours, or A true narrative of the late actings of his Excellencies Life-Guard, since their order for marching up to London to be disbanded: wherein are conteined his Excellencies order for their marching up to London. Their remonstrance in referrence to their solemn engagement. Their proposals in order to disbanding. Their declaration discovering their reasons of seizing upon and securing their standard. With a vindication of divers gentlemen imployed by them. And divers other things giving light to each of them. New published to give satisfaction, aud [sic] to prevent mis-apprehensions concerning the proceedings of the gentlemen of the Life-Guard of his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax.
titleStmt.author: Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "March 3d"; the 8 in imprint date is crossed out and replaced with "7".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
